heading: Sammy Wilson Reelected
body: Sammy Wilson won his North Down and Antrim seat at the June 8 election, with the DUP’s Conor Murphy and Sinn Féin’s Niall Ó Donnghaile being the second and third elected MLAs for their respective parties. The republican party won 28 seats, 13 of which were in the north, while the DUP won 27 seats, 10 of which were in the north. READ MORE: DUP leader Arlene Foster to continue as first minister. Ms Foster told the News Letter that she has been "fully compliant with the rules".
